definition: remote/hidden away/secluded/serene/peaceful/to imprison/in superstition indicates the underworld/ancient district spanning Liaonang and Hebei provinces
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Left alone with him, she entices José with suggestions of a rendezvous that night.
sentences.chinese: 在與賀塞獨處時，卡門誘惑賀塞在晚上與她幽會。

sentences.english: Look at John checking Money out. Do you think he will ask her out?
sentences.chinese: 你瞧約翰在打量莫尼呢。你覺得他會約她外出幽會嗎？

sentences.english: Moreover, Huang Jingao had developed secret codes with the mistresses .
sentences.chinese: 此外，黃金高還與每位情婦都商定了幽會暗號。

sentences.english: Many plans for secret meetings in the woods were hatched.
sentences.chinese: 許多人都在籌劃着在林中幽會。

sentences.english: She described meeting Henry at a party in our town and how their sexual relationship began.
sentences.chinese: 然後告訴我他們在鎮上的聚會上認識，接着開始幽會。

sentences.english: I came out alone on my way to my tryst.
I didn’t worry much about Nick coming home on our Tuesdays together.
sentences.chinese: 每星期二我們幽會時，我不太擔心尼克會突然回家。

sentences.english: One of them wrote her a love letter, insisting upon a private meeting.
sentences.chinese: 其中一個給她寫了一封情書，一定要和她幽會。

sentences.english: But their love-in is not expected to last long.
sentences.chinese: 然而，彼此之間的愛戀幽會預料將不會持續太久。

sentences.english: Did not think their tryst was seen in green.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到他們的幽會卻被採青看到了。

sentences.english: Meanwhile , Fran and Sheldrake meet at the apartment .
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，弗蘭正和希德瑞克在巴德的公寓裏幽會。

definition: person of good character/nice person/bird with a melodious voice or beautiful plumage
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to know each other/to recognize/to identify/to acknowledge (an old relationship)
(of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
